items.text: A Psalm of Asaph.
items.plainText: A Psalm of Asaph.

items.text: Truly God is good to Israel, even to such as are of a clean heart.
items.plainText: Truly God is good to Israel, even to such as are of a clean heart.

items.text: But as for me, my feet were almost gone; my steps had well nigh slipped.
items.plainText: But as for me, my feet were almost gone; my steps had well nigh slipped.

items.text: For I was envious at the foolish, when I saw the prosperity of the wicked.
items.plainText: For I was envious at the foolish, when I saw the prosperity of the wicked.

items.text: For there are no bands in their death: but their strength is firm.
items.plainText: For there are no bands in their death: but their strength is firm.

items.text: They are not in trouble as other men; neither are they plagued like other men.
items.plainText: They are not in trouble as other men; neither are they plagued like other men.

items.text: Therefore pride compasseth them about as a chain; violence covereth them as a garment.
items.plainText: Therefore pride compasseth them about as a chain; violence covereth them as a garment.

items.text: Their eyes stand out with fatness: they have more than heart could wish.
items.plainText: Their eyes stand out with fatness: they have more than heart could wish.

items.text: They are corrupt, and speak wickedly concerning oppression: they speak loftily.
items.plainText: They are corrupt, and speak wickedly concerning oppression: they speak loftily.

items.text: They set their mouth against the heavens, and their tongue walketh through the earth.
items.plainText: They set their mouth against the heavens, and their tongue walketh through the earth.

items.text: Therefore his people return hither: and waters of a full cup are wrung out to them.
items.plainText: Therefore his people return hither: and waters of a full cup are wrung out to them.

items.text: And they say, How doth God know? and is there knowledge in the most High?
items.plainText: And they say, How doth God know? and is there knowledge in the most High?

items.text: Behold, these are the ungodly, who prosper in the world; they increase in riches.
items.plainText: Behold, these are the ungodly, who prosper in the world; they increase in riches.

items.text: Verily I have cleansed my heart in vain, and washed my hands in innocency.
items.plainText: Verily I have cleansed my heart in vain, and washed my hands in innocency.

items.text: For all the day long have I been plagued, and chastened every morning.
items.plainText: For all the day long have I been plagued, and chastened every morning.

items.text: If I say, I will speak thus; behold, I should offend against the generation of thy children.
items.plainText: If I say, I will speak thus; behold, I should offend against the generation of thy children.

items.text: When I thought to know this, it was too painful for me;
items.plainText: When I thought to know this, it was too painful for me;

items.text: Until I went into the sanctuary of God; then understood I their end.
items.plainText: Until I went into the sanctuary of God; then understood I their end.

items.text: Surely thou didst set them in slippery places: thou castedst them down into destruction.
items.plainText: Surely thou didst set them in slippery places: thou castedst them down into destruction.

items.text: How are they brought into desolation, as in a moment! they are utterly consumed with terrors.
items.plainText: How are they brought into desolation, as in a moment! they are utterly consumed with terrors.

items.text: As a dream when one awaketh; so, O Lord, when thou awakest, thou shalt despise their image.
items.plainText: As a dream when one awaketh; so, O Lord, when thou awakest, thou shalt despise their image.

items.text: Thus my heart was grieved, and I was pricked in my reins.
items.plainText: Thus my heart was grieved, and I was pricked in my reins.

items.text: So foolish was I, and ignorant: I was as a beast before thee.
items.plainText: So foolish was I, and ignorant: I was as a beast before thee.

items.text: Nevertheless I am continually with thee: thou hast holden me by my right hand.
items.plainText: Nevertheless I am continually with thee: thou hast holden me by my right hand.

items.text: Thou shalt guide me with thy counsel, and afterward receive me to glory.
items.plainText: Thou shalt guide me with thy counsel, and afterward receive me to glory.

items.text: Whom have I in heaven but thee? and there is none upon earth that I desire beside thee.
items.plainText: Whom have I in heaven but thee? and there is none upon earth that I desire beside thee.

items.text: My flesh and my heart faileth: but God is the strength of my heart, and my portion for ever.
items.plainText: My flesh and my heart faileth: but God is the strength of my heart, and my portion for ever.

items.text: For, lo, they that are far from thee shall perish: thou hast destroyed all them that go a whoring from thee.
items.plainText: For, lo, they that are far from thee shall perish: thou hast destroyed all them that go a whoring from thee.

items.text: But it is good for me to draw near to God: I have put my trust in the Lord GOD, that I may declare all thy works.
items.plainText: But it is good for me to draw near to God: I have put my trust in the Lord GOD, that I may declare all thy works.
